intro: Borago hortensis, commonly known as blueweed or borage, is an herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and large, star-shaped, bright blue or violet flowers. The leaves are broadly ovate with a fuzzy texture and a slightly peppery taste. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often used in gardens for its ornamental value and as a companion plant. The plant is also valued for its historical use in herbal medicine and as a source of edible flowers.
